website_summaries.verdict: A high-tech fruit fly trap that uses light to attract the pests, then wind power to keep them from bothering you again.
pros: Doesn't use anything toxic or poisonous
Instead, a safe, advanced UV light draws fruit flies into the trap's onboard fan, which sucks the fly downward onto a stick surface below
Catches other small insects, too, like mosquitos
cons: Pricey ,and the fan could be more powerful

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Looks fancy and we'll, but in 5 days did not catch a single masquito, and they were around. It's supposed to entice the. To come close with the light, then suck then into the trap. Like said above, did not catch 1 in 5 days.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Came used with no charger and no sticky pads
customer_reviews.text: This item came with a broken seal that says “break seal to open. If this seal has been cut, product should not be put back into inventory.” It obviously was used. Inside the box it was missing the sticky pads and the cable to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: dont buy
customer_reviews.text: the suction on this device is awful, small fruit flies play in and around, it just so happens they find the stick pad and become trapped. buy some glue or use honey, entice it with some fruit juice ( fresh squeezed ) and it will do a much better job, save your money
customer_reviews.author: J. Black

customer_reviews.title: Good for nocturnal insects (not fruit flies)
customer_reviews.text: Has caught gnats, mosquitoes, and a couple of random fly-like bugs. Has not caught fruit flies... which actually makes perfect sense. fruit flies are not nocturnal but rather are most active in the morning. (My wife's a geneticist that uses flies in her research.) In contrast, this device is designed to attract nocturnal insects. Overall, we're keeping the device as we have a lot of mosquitos.
customer_reviews.author: Richard SoRelle

customer_reviews.title: wish it would work with a smart plug
customer_reviews.text: I only thought I had a few fruit flies, but this proves I had a much bigger problem than I thought. Only thing that would have made this a 5-star is if the plug controls were different so that i can control when it turns on and off using a smart switch, something you cannot do with the current controls. An update, I found a smart device to stick to this that will automatically push the button the way I program, (it’s a smart button pusher device). It worked well until my boyfriend misplaced the cord, now i guess I need a replacement. My second recommendation is they could make a universal power cord.
customer_reviews.author: schubie

customer_reviews.title: A noise maker
customer_reviews.text: Sorry to say the little fan in this thing is making a lot of noise. To my ears it isn't a pleasant white noise but a higher pitch noise that is irritating. (it sounds somewhat like a refrigerator running) Even on the low setting I hear it from across the room. I may need to move it to a room that is unoccupied or just unplug it. Edit - After running for 3 months the fan noise has mellowed and is now relatively quiet. As a result I'm changing the rating from 2 to 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this bug trap for four days now and I am just disgusted with how many bugs it has trapped and delighted with how well this works. I didn't think the issue was this bad until we started checking the sticky paper daily. Just nasty! I recommend buying the extra pack of sticky pads if you have a big issue to control as the box only comes with four. So far, I highly recommend this product! We keep it in our utility space with the lights off and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lagana

customer_reviews.title: Caught a Gnat After a Week ... but nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: Not even getting close to the results we read about. We were experiencing a massive fruit fly invasion -- as in 100+ flies. We placed this in the middle of the room that had the most (the kitchen). Each night for a week we shut all lights off and turned Katchy on. In that time period, it caught exact ZERO fruit flies. It did catch a very small gnat. In the end we got rid of the invasion through apply cider vinegar traps and patiently splattering them with a magazine. Was really hopeful for Katchy, but can't recommend it on any level if your intention is to catch fruit flies.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice?
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to cover approx 100 sq. ft but after running them for 2 days, there is not a single flying insect in them. I did however kill a few fruit flys & tiny little flying insects while they were running...LOL, I'm a better bug catcher than the machines. I'm just leaving them on all day long now, since its such a hassle to return, they are going to be a permanent fixture in my house, I hope to get lucky somehow & they will work at some point.
customer_reviews.author: JVC

customer_reviews.title: Waste Of a Money
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks these people’s house must have been infested for it to catch anything it’s been a week and it caught barely 3/4 little tiny flies I’ve tried it in 3 different areas even where the diapers go and nothing please don’t waste your money I’m Mad I even bought this I should’ve stuck to the little apples and I live in Orlando Florida the nation of everything flying Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Indhira Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend! No question, bought another one when last one broke
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Katchy. In all honesty, the one I bought last summer no longer worked when I brought it out this year. Not sure what happened. But it did get knocked around a bit as I took it between work and home. However! I love the Katchy! It works so well!! It was an easy decision for me to get another one, rather than trying some other product. Its quiet. It does a great job. Looks good. Bugs are hidden away inside it. Bugs are flying in my house one day, next morning they see stuck to the disc in the Katchy. Gnats, flies, bugs I dont even know what they are but they fly. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAmberK

customer_reviews.title: Helps with Fungus Gnats from Houseplants!
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of houseplants and my husband was at his wits ends with the amount of little gnats flying around. This Catchy definitely helps reduce the problem, but I want to add that if your problem is gnats due to houseplants, these kinds of devices will only get rid of the adult/mature bugs. To fully solve the problem, you have to stop them from continually breeding in the soil of your plants. The biggest thing is to stop overwatering. You can also try bottom watering, you can treat your soil with diluted hydrogen peroxide, add mosquito bits to the soil, etc. BUT, this Catchy definitely catches a ton of them, and I'd definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Berry

customer_reviews.title: updated review
customer_reviews.text: This product does work to catch some of the flying bugs in the room, which is good, but I had originally been led to to believe by some of the reviews I read that it works for mosquitos. But when receiving the product the manual said it doesn't work on mosquitoes, at least not in rooms where people are sleeping, and customer service confirmed that. If it was my company I would tell that to people up front in the description, rather than provoke bad reviews. But this company did refund my purchase without making me ship it back, so I'm happy overall now.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: cool design but ineffective
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed as didnt work at all. Looks great but had an infestation of fruit flies and stuck it right next to them and not one got sucked in. Perhaps a defective model?
customer_reviews.author: ENU

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work in Texas
customer_reviews.text: We live in Liberty Hill TX and the mosquitoes are crazy here. I ordered this hoping to kill the mosquitoes that sneak in through the doggy door and when doors open briefly but it’s been running for almost a week on the kitchen island and nothing. It has caught 1 fruit fly. Our house is 3500 sq ft single story. We still wake up with random bites all over. It’s a very nice, well built and attractive mosquito trap but it simply hasn’t worked for us. Returning this week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic fly control
customer_reviews.text: I got this fly trap because it looks nice, and to my surprise it also works surprisingly well. It's ~2x as effective as bare fly paper and I don't have to look at bare fly paper :) Don't buy their sticky pad refills though, those are a scam. You can get a pack of 30 double-sided fly papers and just cut them to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: We still get bit in the house
customer_reviews.text: Even though we tried to be careful when we open/close our doors and windows, we get unwelcome guests (fruit flies, flies, mosquitoes and small moths). I was skeptical about this product. I bought one to test it out by the entrance. We get more bugs during the night than day. We get bit every night which was really annoying and irritating. I had it for one full day but nothing caught on the bottom filter. We tested it out for a week and saw one or two. I guess it takes time for the bugs to notice the blue light or they are not attracted.
customer_reviews.author: AYAME28

customer_reviews.title: My Cat’s New Favorite Toy
customer_reviews.text: My cat quickly found out the first night that this device attracted all the bugs. So he camped out in front of it and every time there’d be a bug going into the trap he’d swipe at it and kill it himself haha! He was having a blast. Nevertheless, when I woke up this morning, there were maybe 5 bugs trapped in there. The bugs in Washington where I am are huge, and the fan doesn’t seem to allow for a lot of room or be super sucky, so I can’t imagine they’d all manage to get sucked in, but the smaller flies and moths were. I’ll update my rating if it happens to get the big bugs too.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna

customer_reviews.title: Gets the little buggers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because all of these teeny bugs seem to get in at night through my air conditioner or tiny gaps. They were driving me crazy landing in my drink or smacking into my Kindle when I was reading. I leave the low setting on all night, and it catches quite a lot of bugs. If I'm using my Kindle I have to put the Katchy on the high setting. The light is brighter so it helps to draw them away from the Kindle. This works perfectly for what I needed. My ONLY complaint is that the cord is so short, you have to have it right above an outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Rue

customer_reviews.title: Modestly Effective For Fruit Flies
customer_reviews.text: It's about as loud as an old computer; I don't hear it over a nearby air purifier though. As is, positioned next to a fruit bowl, four fruit flies were killed overnight. The next day, I placed a pomegranate aril on the fan grill and caught twice as many. The UV light also adds an attractive ambiance to the room's lighting. I'm going to try to replace the included fan with a quieter one (like a Noctua).
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Solved our problems
customer_reviews.text: We tried everything else - some that had even worked before - but nothing was working with the tiny fruit flies we had in our kitchen. My problem was almost gone over night and two days later we had no flies left. It is very satisfying to see the sticky bad loaded with dead bugs. This is quiet and not the ugliest thing you could put on your counter. I gave it only four stars because of the note in the directions that says it is not for continuous use. I have been using it for a week at a time with no issues, but I was turned off by this aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Pest Trap! Easy to use!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!!! I never write reviews but the fruit flies were driving us mad even though we were using the conventional method with apple cider vinegar in another product we bought from Amazon. It just didn’t do the job though!! As you can see it caught so many fruit flies and I was amazed at the moth! The cap inside does not come with the unit but we added apple cider vinegar to it to attract the flies. Amazing product and priced right. So easy to use! Very happy! I did order more sticky pads as well for refills. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Sweetbea

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this! I was a little skeptical I saw this on a household hacks YouTube video and immediately ordered it. I have a problem with tiny gnats in my household plants I set this next to it and plugged it in it does omit a little bit of noise but not enough to bother anyone or really be noticed in my house so that is in no way a deterrent for me. the cats don’t mess with it it’s perfect I’m gonna order another one for the upstairs immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Firefly25

customer_reviews.title: Not effective, flies will mock you
customer_reviews.text: It’s just too slow to work. I don’t think it even works on basic house flies. I watched a couple of them just dance around the fan surface - mocking this thing and me. After a a few weeks in a room full of flies, it caught some gnats and 1 small fly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Davey

customer_reviews.title: Shocked how well this works
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how anyone could give this a bad rating. Fruit flies spread FAST in my house, and I tried the expensive bars (which are poisonous & didn't work at all). I just plugged this in and within a few hours it had already caught more than I could count! SOOO HAPPY IT WORKS, some of the 1 star reviews had me scared. Works best if you turn of all lights at night except the lamp so they fly towards the light.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bugs Beware!
customer_reviews.text: It's a lot smaller and lighter than expected but I think I like those qualities. Easy to work and nice design that looks good anywhere. I like the switches -- they have a nice "click" to them and light up when you turn them on. The best part is that it works. The first time I used it I got two guys. Then it went quiet for a while but tonight I caught a bunch more pesky jerks that I didn't even know lurked in my home!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work at all for me. I had it on 24/7 for two weeks and I snagged 19 flies. I put out a cut with some rum and a drop of dish soap and got 25 in 4hrs. I was very aggravating to acutely see the flies land on the outside of the trap and not go in. I sent mine back and will stick to my home trap.
customer_reviews.author: 1badnana

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this so much I just bought a second one so I could have one upstairs and one downstairs. Wish they came with more replacement pads but oh well. Only tip is make sure all other lights are off at night so that the bigs go to it. I got it for a fruit fly problem I had and it helped a ton. I also did Apple cider dish soap, but when I woke up this product had 20+ flies in it. You can add an attractant like Apple cider vinegar next to it to bring fruit flies closer (or whatever attractant your bug likes). Then you have light and smell bringing it close
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased to address a fruit fly problem. Kids leaving dirty dishes in the sink caused an increase in fruit flies. We have tried fly strips. They work but are unsightly having them hanging in our kitchen. Decided to try this insect trap. It works, but not as good as the fly paper. After about a week of running this, there are fewer flies than the fly paper. Also, the fan is starting to rattle. So I am not sure about the longevity of this trap.
customer_reviews.author: BRIANK

customer_reviews.title: So great and SAFE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!!! there is someone on here in product review that gives a secret for a cheaper alternative to the sticky pads which I haven't tried yet....but the ones they send you keep and trap mosquitoes and fruit flies and even a mini beetle was found in there. Forrom someone who has dealt with this a fruit fly problem here for two plus years....I couldn't have asked for a better GOD SEND! And the fact that it is a UV light and not a zapper I never have to fear accidental injury! THANK YOU KATCHY!!!! ❤❤❤
customer_reviews.author: ForbiddenHeart

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for mosquito trapping.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to trap mosquitos. Tried it out for over a month, as instructed. Only trapped moths. Mosquitos are still thriving.
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Brookes

customer_reviews.title: I had no idea how much I needed this
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea there were so many bugs in my place until purchasing this, originally purchased because I started to notice gnats more frequently in my kitchen. After running for just two days there was about 75+ tiny mosquitos, bugs and flies trapped inside the Katchy. I run this 24/7 and especially overnight, the device is completely silent and without it I would probably be overrun by small invisible gnats, mosquitos and flies!
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Wow.. perfect indoor big trap
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this is everything I could have wanted. It works, and it works, anddddd it works. Also, it’s pretty quiet. Just look at the photos. I have this setup in my my studio office that has doors that go directly outside when opened. So a lot of small bugs and flys come in. This has fixed that issue and is easy to operate. The sticky pad is easy to replace. 10/10. It obviously is most effective in the complete dark when the light can attract bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica C.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Like all insect battles, nothing works completely, but I do find a lot of those pesky fungus gnats stuck to the sticky trap at the bottom. I recommend a multi-pronged attack on those darn critters (I also use mosquito bits in houseplant soil and live Mexican butterwort plants), but this DOES work. I may eventually get one or two more so that I can cover more affected rooms. Also, when it is on at night, the blacklight effect on white things is rather cool.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Burke

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sent me a used item with missing parts
customer_reviews.text: So I got this product and the box seal that said " returned item, do not stock for resale" was ripped. As I opened the box it was missing the power cord and the sticky pads for the bottom. So amazon sent me a used item. I found a old cord I had that worked for it so I tried it out. It does attract bugs and even without the sticky pad they tend to not be able to get out and they die.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Farr

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL
customer_reviews.text: we have an unusually high amount of mosquitoes even in the house this year. My poor granddaughter and I are being eaten alive. This little machine works great and although it says it doesn't catch flies I see a couple in there. was skeptical but It's awesome! I don't know about thickness, not sure I understand that and the adhesion must be good because there are bugs stuck in there
customer_reviews.author: Demi

customer_reviews.title: Kills gnats real well
customer_reviews.text: I have now tried the three top selling versions of this item on Amazon. I am using them to catch fungus gnats. This is catches 30% more fungus gnats in a 24 hour period than it's two competitors. I do wish it had a "night light" feature like one of the competitors, only turning on once all other lights in the room have turned off, but this really does catch so many more gnats I just don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: For some reasons, I had infestation of biting midges in my house, and I was desperate to get something to get rid of them. Based on great review, I gave it a try, but it caught only a few bugs overnight. Disappointed and I Googled and made a mix of apple vinegar, sugar and dish soap, put it in a small dish over night, and this mix caught at lease a several dozens of them overnight. I returned it and stick to my mix which costs me nothing to make it.
customer_reviews.author: Miami kItty mom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome MUST BUY for mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.text: I did not think this thing would work but holy smokes! This is just from one night of having it plugged in. It's super easy to use (watch the quick video). We bought this double sided yellow plant paper. I used the Katchy trap papers as a model to cut circles out of the yellow paper so now we have more refills for cheaper. We also stuck those yellow trap papers on a stick & stuck them in our indoor plants & caught so many more mosquitoes. Ugh this year is horrid in our area.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Really good product. I placed it by a container I have that attracts gnats and I have not had a problem with them since plugging this up. I didn’t get the sticky pads with it. The box arrived beat up and the bottom was kind of open. I’m not sure if the sticky pads were there and fell out and not sure if it was seller or carrier error. Ordered some sticky pads separately. Works really well! Will order another one to place in the kitchen. Definitely order this if you have gnats and/or flies.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: I bought more.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 and put in the bedrooms. We pretty much have been killing as many as we could before bed and then we hide under covers so we don’t get bit up all night. It was amazing. First night I could sleep without covers and not one bite. I just bought 2 more for the rest of the house. We have a few months out of the year when they are bad. Hoping to use these those months every year.
customer_reviews.author: Lorene Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. Saw the product on a YouTube review for bugs and I bought it right away. Used for the first time by my main trash bin and it’s alright caught some gnats! I feel more comfortable leaving my side door open or my windows open to let the breeze in knowing little pests won’t be a problem. Also bought a pack of the sticky bottoms, great deal and worth it. Very easy to use and includes a great guide with tips.
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: So.....many.......fruit flies..........
customer_reviews.text: Jesus, I didn't know the problem was as bad as it is. I don't understand where the F all of these fruit flies are coming from. I have a perfectly well kept kitchen with zero food left out. I woke up to check the Katchy and was shocked, there were about 30 fruit fly nats and a moth..... I don't understand. Where.....where the F are they hiding............ this thing works. Will be replacing the sticky trap today and checking it again tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: THANK GOD FOR THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I caught 4 in my room within 30 minutes of turning this thing on, it's been my lord and savior since these mf-ing mosquito have been chewing me ALIVE!! I'm still on sticker number 1 - yes it sucks that they don't give you more, but what can you do, Its honestly worth getting your blood sucked every 2 seconds, like this year couldn't get any worse. This thing makes it a little bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Delia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Omg this is an amazing product, the first one I bought never arrived and I spoke with customer service and received a replacement. I thought I would never find anything that would help with my gnat issue. Man this was a life save it is amazing!! I no longer have issues and feel like I am constantly killing something lol this little treasure gets them all. I recommend anyone looking for something to rid of gnats mosquitoes anything like that, this is a MUST HAVE!! It was and still is a lifesaver for me.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: This product is a lifesaver for those who attract mosquitoes!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the deep South and the summertime is the absolute worst for mosquitoes and biting flies. We purchased this as a last ditch effort to save us from the summertime plague. We place this in our bedroom, not expecting much... But this is the result. We don’t leave our doors open, except to let our pets in and out. As you can see, these bad boys find any way to come inside. I finally can sleep without the buzzing and don’t wake up with neck and arms full of bites. Thanks for a great product! Simple and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does what it’s made to do!
customer_reviews.text: So satisfied! I used this so far for one night on my back porch In Florida. The porch is mostly screened in, but we’ve had some screens damaged, so we don’t get as many bugs as we would outside, but they still get in and we’ve had mosquitoes even in the middle of the afternoon. I was a little nervous of the reviews that said this didn’t work, but it absolutely does. I think one thing that may be different is that our back porch is very dark at night so this would be the only light they would be attracted to, so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Re-review of Katchy
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this 4-stars more for customer service than function. I reviewed this product shortly after receiving it and gave it a poor review. I was contacted by Katchy almost immediately with an apology, a complete refund, and suggestions about how to make it work. I tried their suggestions and it did work what I would call just so-so. Maybe my idea of how it was to work was overly optimistic. Therefore I give their customer service a 5 and the product itself a 3.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money looking at 4 out of 5 reviews
customer_reviews.text: DOESN'T WORK AT ALL. I bought it looking at the reviews. We recently had a lot of fruit flies in the home. I ran this unit as instructed. At night, near fruits / trash can / with apple cider vinegar. Tried for 4 nights. Not even a single bug trapped whatsoever. Looks fancy, but its useless. I wonder where all these 4/5 reviews come from.
customer_reviews.author: prashant

customer_reviews.title: It works! I’m so happy and almost gnat free!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness what a difference Katchy has made in my home. I made the mistake of bringing an infested plant home and I have been dealing with a terrible infestation since. In just a couple of days, it has made a dramatic difference and I can stand being in my home. I have never been so satisfied with a purchase and I ended up buying another one to keep in my bedroom. I recommend buying if you have a fungus gnat problem and follow all of the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Annette

customer_reviews.title: Great product, extremely happy!
customer_reviews.text: I am SO happy with this product! It's a little wizard that works like advertised and is priced reasonable. I bought it for a fruit fly problem. Within 2 hours of it being on , it had trapped dozens of them! I am very happy with the quality of Katchy as well as the company. I received my order from them through Amazon within a week. Great service, product and price. Would absolutely buy again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ferne Young

customer_reviews.title: Mosquitos be gone
customer_reviews.text: My four year old get a serious reaction to mosquito bites so we decided to try this out. Out of the box it’s very easy to use. It’s most effective at night which is why I gave it 4 and not 5 stars. I wish it had a daytime feature so I can run it all day. Other than that I have no complaints. It’s been catching the mosquitos that have made their way into my sons room. It’s quiet and the light is actually a perfect night light as well. I recommend it .
customer_reviews.author: MEL

customer_reviews.title: Well made, decent price, a little bit noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and set-up. The light works well to attract insects in our case fungus gnats. My only qualm is the noise from the fan. Probably couldn't sleep with it in the same room unless you want a while noise machine.
customer_reviews.author: skylar

customer_reviews.title: Hardly the savior from our insect overlords that they'd have you believe...
customer_reviews.text: We've been running our Katchy 24/7 for 3 days or so in close proximity to our kitchen garbage can where we've been noticing some fruit flies, etc. It's caught a few things on the sticky trap, but not much. We still have a bug problem. It's really nothing special. It's a light above a fan that points at a sticky piece of paper. To call it an "appliance" is giving it a lot of credit. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: amongmany

customer_reviews.title: Works really well in smaller areas and in complete darkness.
customer_reviews.text: Small, quiet and effective. Be aware that this doesn’t zap bugs. The light attracts them, the fan pulls them in and then they stick to the glue disk at the bottom of the unit. Works best when it’s the only light source in the room. Good for small areas like living room/dining room. Wish i could watch tv and have it on at the same time. Light source just isn’t strong enough to lure all of them away from the tv, iPad or iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Emmaphlema

customer_reviews.title: Worrrkkkkks!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little machine doesn’t look bad, it’s pretty quiet and it WORKS. Just bought a fixer upper in a slightly more rural area. There are a lot of little flying critters around it it was driving me crazy. I got this guy and it has cut down the number down tremendously. I still see some here and there but we’re still in the process of replacing windows and screen so they’re getting in pretty easily. I attached a photo showing how many flies, fruit flies etc we’ve trapped in a week.
customer_reviews.author: Leilss

customer_reviews.title: Already opened, missing parts
customer_reviews.text: Nothing worse than paying good money to get a previously opened item missing the sticky pads and a power cord. Why do they try to get away with this nonsense? Like I am not going to write a bad review???
customer_reviews.author: lonnyzone

customer_reviews.title: So awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had really been wanting these for fruit flies for awhile, so I finally bought it. No REGERTS. LOL. This thing is wonderful, so wonderful in fact, that I bought another one for my plant room for gnats. The sticky tabs are full a lot. Replacement tabs are inexpensive and it does a great job, both in the kitchen and in the plant room.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani

customer_reviews.title: Excellent - very happy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this after we moved into our new home. The backyard has a lot more vegetation than we're used to... with a lot more flying pests because of it! Mosquitoes, in particular, were becoming a huge problem. I ended up buying two of these on recommendation of a friend. We set one up by our patio door, and another one in our hallway upstairs... AND WOW! It's worked out SO well! It's trapped a ton of gnats and mosquitoes. After about only 2-3 days, we had no new itchy bites to worry about! And it's pretty quiet while running too! Highly recommend this product - it's worked so well for us!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Maul

customer_reviews.title: Works great.....👊👊👊
customer_reviews.text: Already caught a fruit fly and it's been on for a couple of hours. So excited. Theirs 2 in the trap already. How awesome I dont have to hear my hub say kill this bug every seconds.😁👍👍👍👍👍👍 update 10 23, so it's been 2 weeks and second picture says it all. Def a good buy and works better at night, but def works during day too.
customer_reviews.author: Gina salvo

customer_reviews.title: Fine overall, skimped on cable
customer_reviews.text: Works well and looks relatively nice. But the power cord is definitely too short for something that you may potentially want to position in different locations/rooms on a regular basis. Not sure why the manufacturer felt it was necessary to skimp there. Not to mention that they went with a custom USB to barrel connector cable assembly rather than just using a standard USB cable, for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: Humboldt

customer_reviews.title: Great for gnats, mosquitoes and moths in small places.
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for small light insects. Even with the screen door and window screens, I get a ton of small bugs inside and this has been great. I’ve had it a week and haven’t seen hardly anything flying around, even with a bunch of fruit sitting out. When I check the sticky pad at the bottom, you can tell it definitely works. Best for a single room or small apartment or camper. I agree with the product label that it’s not meant for flies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! We like to leave our porch door open in the evenings and we always get small bugs in the house. I’ve only had it plugged in for about and hour and it already caught 4 flies. To compare, I bought a competing brand at Bed Bath & Beyond, and in 24 hours it didn’t catch anything! Highly recommend KATCHY. And it’s aesthetically pleasing!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Hodge

customer_reviews.title: Not effective for larger flying insects. Fan not strong enough!
customer_reviews.text: Fan is just not strong enough to pull in a small to medium fly. The fly basically toyed with the device, walked all around the top grill just below the light and even into the second grill but never sucked it. The fan is just not moving enough air for larger flying insects. Fruit flies, gnats, maybe but horse, house, or stable flies I don't think so. Unless the fly gets exhausted and gives up. Inefficient in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Bought Manual On/Off When I could have bought auto on/off for the same price.
customer_reviews.text: It might take a few days but it eventually gets rid of everything in the house. Bought the manual one. Usually Amazon has the note "THERE IS A NEWER VERSION OF THIS" but not this time. Now I'm stuck with it. The auto on/off is a nice feature I would have liked to have had, especially for the same price. Rip. Other than that, it works better than expected! Even catches moths and mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: Camper Van Beethoven

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little beauties work wonderfully! They suck in gnats, mosquitoes, and "no see 'ums" in astonishing numbers. Best of all, the sticky pads are super easy to change out, and give proof of how many of the little devils you have been saved from. If you live in bug country, you ought to have a couple of these things.
customer_reviews.author: Iggity7

customer_reviews.title: The jury is out
customer_reviews.text: We have used it for over a week right now. We put it on early each evening, close the windows and doors, shut out the lights. I don't see much in the way of trapped mosquitoes and my wife says she is still getting bitten during the night. We have tried it with both air conditioning on and off, with no difference. We will try it for a few more days and see the effect.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Straightarrow

customer_reviews.title: Came refurbished but I did not order it refurbished...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product brand new thinking it would come nicely packaged. I received it looking as if it was refurbished when I payed full price. It was sealed off with a sticker instead of the original packaging. Then when I opened the box, there were zero glue pads. Lucky for me I ordered more but it said that is was supposed to come with it but it did not. My pads are going to take a week to arrive so I am unable to use this. I suggest checking to make sure you are getting what you are paying for before buying. Make sure it includes the pads and not coming refurbished when you pay full price.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Bleet

customer_reviews.title: Delivers exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Wow this product does everything it promises .. I had a little gnat or two that would buzz around in my home office but to the point that it was irritating every now and then and I wanted a solution. Discovered this product ... price was decent .. so figured I’d try it out ... placed it in the room overnight in complete darkness and the next morning ... wow!!! There were over 20 or more caught. I’m a believer and will be ordering one more for my kitchen
customer_reviews.author: RN Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Don’t knock it til you try it!!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried everything before getting the Katchy. I tried pouring boiling hot water down the drains, vinegar in bowls, and bug spray nothing worked. That’s is until the Katchy. I put a few drops of vinegar on the sticky swatch before putting it in the machine. I turn the Katchy on at night just before bed and wake up with visitors on the swatch. I am shocked that I’ve only had this for 4 days and caught over 20 fruit flies. Those suckers would be crawling on our faces at night causing huge acne bumps and attacking us while eating something sweet, full blown invasion of privacy. NOT ANYMORE thanks to the KATCHY. Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: KYCB

customer_reviews.title: Improved Situation
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I wish I had found this sooner. I had intentionally purchased this item for my 10 pound Shih Tzu, who sleeps in her own bed on the floor. My poor little girl is scratching all night and wakes up with little bumps all over her, as do I . It did take me at least two nights to find the right position in the house for the Katchy. Once I discovered the best position, which was at the entryway to the room in which we sleep, we have been seven days mosquito free through the night. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Meshel Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Small and very efficient.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I was skeptical but also desperate to eradicate little bugs from my home. We set it every night in the kitchen and wake up to a sticky pad full of little tiny winged bugs. Some are mosquitos! Most are gnats. It says it doesn’t work on files, but I would be very excited to wake up one morning and see a fly on there. We love it! It works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase, no more bug bites!
customer_reviews.text: I have been eaten alive this season by mosquitoes, waking up with five or six new bites routinely (I have a puppy so the back door was open a lot during the summer evenings). Once I got this device, the bites were nearly eliminated. It caught the little gnats I didn't even know were there in addition to the mosquitoes. The fan isn't at all bothersome but the light can be - put it behind a lamp or on the lower setting if you dont want it right in your eyes...or place it on the other side of the room. It does have to be placed in a dark room or it isn't effective. I would recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Bratton

customer_reviews.title: Works well not blue light is bright for sleeping and fan a not noisy, even on low setting
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with this purchase. Was getting many mosquito bites at night in bed. No idea how they are getting in. In 5 nights counted 23 mosquitos, many gnats and 2 months on the sticky pad. I was unable to keep this year in my bedroom as the blue light is too bright for me and the fan a not too loud for sensitive sleepers. But, placed it in my attached bathroom with door open just a few inches and sleep fine. Will be buying 2 more for other parts of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Gia

customer_reviews.title: Didn't catch anything for two nights in a row
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this so much. We bought it because of the flies and mosquitos that keep getting into the house. I did everything the instructions said to do (PS mentions in the book its really doesn't work for house flies, but didn't say that online). Woke up for two nights after having it on all night with nothing on the "sticky pad". Returned the item no problem. Maybe it would work if you had a home that gets TOTALLY dark at night and can use it in an enclosed room. As for my open floor plan home, it didn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn keefer

customer_reviews.title: This item does NOT work. Ordered onDec 11 returning for refund  today!
customer_reviews.text: To eradicate gnates in house. From Dec 11 2019 To Dec 28 2019 TWO gnates are stuck dead on the Trap bait! At least 100 more gnates are thriving in My bathroom where the trap is located. I consulted a person knowledgeable in pest control And he confirmed I had set up the device correctly! Returning item!
customer_reviews.author: Edith K. Farris

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: It works a bit better than simple window stick tape, but overall it feels like a cheap prototype. The fan is too noisy to keep in a quiet room, although there is a low setting which is quieter. It doesn't have a sensor to turn on automatically at night and has push buttons to turn on so it can't be connected to a smart outlet. The replacement pads are overprices too, but you could just cut your own to size.
customer_reviews.author: mobiusred

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: The photos I posted were after only one night of use! The fan is so quiet I can hardly hear it. Very easy to use and directions are simple as well. Directions say it may take up to 3 days but for me the effect was immediate! I’m so happy because it is the time of the year where my indoor plants become home to these annoying dirt gnats. Product works great! The only downfall is the short cord 🤷🏼‍♀️ Otherwise very happy 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Christine Raduluff

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently struggling with a gnat problem in my bathroom and was simply overwhelmed with the amount of gnats I had to kill. I saw this and wanted to give it a shot. This thing really works!! It won’t fix the source but it works great to kill the problem short-term.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki C

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Please don't purchase this, I bought two and set one next to me and one next to my Wife while sitting outside, nadda, nothing, ran one over night, still not one single bug the next morning. Worthless, brand new and I will toss them into the trash because if I don't, they will take up room in the garage and eventually get tossed anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick E. McfaddenTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: So this product kind of works. I have a major fruit fly problem right now and I had it set up overnight, in the problem area. They are everywhere. This thing only caught 5 fruit flies. There are 2 flying around in the canister, not sticking to the adhesive paper. I am very disappointed with this item.
customer_reviews.author: Malorie

customer_reviews.title: GET THIS!
customer_reviews.text: I dont usually write reviews because I am lazy, but bc I am so happy with this purchase I am writing it. I've been so sick of gnats and mosquitos in our house this year, and if I put out those sticky fly ribbons they don't catch shit except for me accidently touching them lol so I saw these and decided to get them bc I saw other good reviews. The pics attached are after 1 and a half days of use. I am very satisfied. I enjoy checking my trap to see if it caught new bugs lol I bought 2, one in kitchen one in bathroom
customer_reviews.author: jesh

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This nifty little bug catcher works well. I leave it on at night and it's caught all sorts of nasty little creatures. I've caught mainly gnats and moths in mine. I'm using it instead of a zapper, which was too loud for me. This is pretty quiet and unobtrusive. Comes with extra sticky pads as well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter K.

customer_reviews.title: It works! (just not instantly)
customer_reviews.text: It definitely works. No, you're not going to wake up after one day of having it plugged in and all of your fruit flies be gone, but it will work. I didn't even know moths had gotten inside nbu house until I opened it to check how many bugs it had caught! We keep it on all the time now and it has taken care of any wayward mosquitoes and fruit flies for us.
customer_reviews.author: Iakavou

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye flies.
customer_reviews.text: Every summer, we have an issue with fruit flies and house flies. We have one in the kitchen that is only turned on at night. The one in our living room (see photo) is always on. Every time I open the door for the dogs, at least one fly comes in the house. With Katchy, the flies don't last long, and the annoyance is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Fur Mama & the Migraine Saga

customer_reviews.title: Does What It Says
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for about a week, and I am extremely happy with my purchase so far. I live in an apartment that faces a grassy area and golf course, so as expected, my unit attracts many insects, especially during the warm spring and summer months. I decided to give this bug catcher a try, and I am impressed. Just in the first use, I was able to catch 3 gnats and 1 mosquito. If you are debating whether to get this or not, please do. It works wonders, and you'll thank yourself for preventing these insects from becoming a nuisance!
customer_reviews.author: Tushster

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately mine turned on for a few seconds, let out an electrical smell, and never turned on again
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great Contraption!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little bug catcher! I ordered the white, and I will say I was really surprised at how big it is lol. The first night I caught about five gnats on the low setting, and by the second night I had 17! The light is bright, and it does give off a subtle humming sound.
customer_reviews.author: Deja G.

customer_reviews.title: removes fruit flies and gnats, even some house flies
customer_reviews.text: I had a fruit fly and gnat problem in my apartment that this got rid of! I've had it for months and it continues to keep them gone. Even caught a few house flies! It's easy to change the pads and they last a long time for me. It looks nice on my counter too. The blacklight lighting everything up that's white at night is a tiny bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Star Petal

customer_reviews.title: Works even without the disc on clothes moths
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep a clothes moth infestation under control. I inadvertently ran it without a disc, and it worked great! The bugs (about 50/day) were unable to escape against the fan at standard speed, and probably died of dehydration. I dump them out in the winter cold just to be sure. I'm saving the discs for mosquito/black fly season.
customer_reviews.author: MiddBill

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and aesthetic
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this. It’s not hideous to have out and it does the job better than I could have hoped for. I have an absurd amount of indoor plants that get soil flies in the summer. Then the big flies come in when we open the doors etc. Last year we did fly tape which was gross and I hated it. This year I got this and it’s caught everything that flies. We turn it on and night and turn it off in the am. Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Gee

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Good product for my daughter’s room. We live in the country surrounded by acres of almond trees. We get the tiny almond bugs that fly into the house in the summer. This product takes care of these bugs, nats and mosquitoes. I don’t order the round glue disks as the are too much money. I take a flat bug glue trap and use an exacto knife to cut it into the circle.
customer_reviews.author: Momofone03

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed a fruit fly invasion
customer_reviews.text: One of the things about being able to compost is that sometimes the indoor compost gets full and very exciting to fruit flies. On one such occasion, in desperation I bought this trap. As soon as I got it, I put the sticky pad in and turned it on. A day later, the fruit fly invasion was halved, and within a few days I was only seeing one random fly here and there. I'm very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dances With Cats

customer_reviews.title: It took a couple of days and I did'nt have too many, but it worked!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't like that you can't run it 24 hrs a day. Makes me worry why? Otherwise, does catch those pesky fruit flies, only part time because of the caveat of not to run it 24 hrs a day.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda H

customer_reviews.title: It's quiet.
customer_reviews.text: NOT what we expected- we had fruit flies, no matter what we did. It's a simple plastic case with a black light and some sticky paper on the bottom. It worked when the room was totally dark, it was plugged in and left on overnight. Caught random flying insects that were very nearby. Not impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Pagano

customer_reviews.title: Helps rid of fruit flies!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for a few weeks and I definitely see a difference. I had fruit flies flying around and now they are gone. I also put a small plastic container with apple cider vinegar or red wine next to the Katchy and it helps attract the fruit flies to the Katchy.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela L.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has given me back a sense of comfort in my home again, I've seen this thing catch big flies,mosquitoes and fruit flies with the help of a little bit of beer this machine works guy's here a pic after 3 days of use
customer_reviews.author: Big Dawg !

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: This summer I had a large infestation of gnats and fruit flies. I had no idea where they were coming from as the last five years in this house have been no problem. I later discovered the problem was a disposal that is rarely used having a nest on gnats in it. The Katchy was placed in my kitchen where they were most noticeable and I could fill half an adhesive pad a night. It cut down severely on the bugs and has since been moved to separate rooms to take care of any remainders. I highly recommend it for anyone with a gnat or fruit fly issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this because it seemed less messy than other indoor bug zappers. It is unobtrusive. We placed it behind a photo frame - you can't see it. It has already captured some bugs. There is basically silent. The recommendation to turn out all the lights and run it at night was helpful. We normally leave a downstairs light on, but we've been turning the light off which makes the Katchy work better.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Todd Evans

customer_reviews.title: It works!! Never bought this before and used household items. This works so much better
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect! Even on the regular setting it is quiet and I wake up and find that it captures houseflies and any fruit flies that we thought were gone or not even in the house. We leave it on all day and night but nighttime is the best since it continues to work. I highly recommend this product if you have any issues with gnats, houseflies or fruit flies. If you see one or two fruit flies, I guarantee you have a ton more and just don’t see them. Don’t try outdoors, it will scare you how many bugs it gets in under 15 minutes. Just ordered more pads
customer_reviews.author: Brad and Tara

product_meta.title: KATCHY Indoor Insect Trap: Bug, Fruit Fly, Gnat, Mosquito Killer - UV Light, Fan, Sticky Glue Boards Trap Flying Bugs - No Zapper - (White)
feature_bullets: KATCH RELIEF: with 3X TRAP POWER the UV light attracts the fruit fly, gnat, or mosquito, the fan sucks it in, and the sticky glue boards trap it.
BEAUTIFUL DESIGN: Easily place in your home kitchen, office, or outdoors as a decorative, stylish piece. No more ugly traps or fly paper.
TRAP INDOORS: Set close to insect-ridden fruit, plants or trash bin. Turn off lights for best results.
REDUCES pests, but is not a complete insect killer lamp, and should not replace your bug repellent/control system. Does not kill house flies.
CUSTOMER SATISFACTION: If you aren't happy with the bug catcher, contact us and we will find a solution together!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,432 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
